title: Tech Down on Trade Deal, GrubHub Worries — Tech Roundup
text:
The technology sector fell amid worries about U.S.-China trade deal and the profitability of newer stock-market entrants.

Grubhub shares registered their biggest one-day decline ever Tuesday, falling more than 40% after it warned it would have to spend more on promotions. Investors have grown skeptical about the profit potential in the increasingly competitive food-delivery- and taxi-app businesses, once heralded as key parts of the "sharing economy."

Sony said it plans to shutter its PlayStation Vue streaming television service early next year due to intensifying competition. Mobile game developer Scopely raised $200 million to focus on growth through acquisitions and otherwise, as reported earlier.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 29, 2019 17:16 ET (21:16 GMT)
